document.heading: District of Columbia Drug Prevention and Children at Risk Tax Check-Off Amendment Act of 1990

history.narrative: Law 8-246, the “District of Columbia Drug Prevention and Children at Risk Tax Check-Off Amendment Act of 1990,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-561, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 4, 1990, and December 18, 1990, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 27, 1990, it was assigned Act No. 8-330 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
